summary: This is a transcript of a September 22, 2021 interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with Mark Epstein, brother of Jeffrey Epstein. Mark Epstein presents detailed arguments and evidence challenging the official suicide ruling of his brother's death in prison, suggesting it was a homicide. He discusses autopsy findings, broken cameras, suspicious prison procedures, and potential motives involving Jeffrey Epstein's knowledge of powerful figures.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive/dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Officially ruled a suicide.

events.title: Autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Autopsy conducted the day after death by the city pathologist, observed by Dr. Barton. Findings included three broken bones in the neck and other wounds. Initial cause of death was 'pending.'

events.title: Cause of Death Changed to Suicide
events.description: A few days after the autopsy, the Chief Medical Examiner of New York declared the death a suicide, contrary to the initial 'pending' status and the observations of the attending pathologist and Dr. Barton.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on federal sex trafficking charges. Mark Epstein last spoke to him the Thursday night before the arrest.

events.title: Scheduled Bail Hearing
events.description: A bail hearing was scheduled for approximately August 11, 2019, two days after Jeffrey Epstein's death. Mark Epstein had agreed to guarantee the bail, which was close to $100 million.

events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General interviews Mark Epstein regarding the investigation into his brother's death.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein argues his brother's death was a homicide, not a suicide, citing a broken camera on the tier, a ligature mark inconsistent with a bedsheet, three broken neck bones unusual for a 'soft hanging,' and evidence Jeffrey was dead for at least two hours before being found.
Mark Epstein states that forensic pathologist Dr. Barton, who observed the autopsy, concluded the death looked more like a homicide, a view shared by the city pathologist who performed it.

Mark Epstein claims Attorney General Barr's statement that video showed no one entered or left the tier convinced him it was a suicide, but Mark argues this logic is flawed because a killer could have already been on the tier.

Mark Epstein reveals he had agreed to guarantee Jeffrey Epstein's bail (close to $100 million) just days before Jeffrey's death, and a bail hearing was scheduled two days after he died, which Mark says makes a pre-hearing suicide illogical.

Mark Epstein speculates about motives, suggesting Jeffrey Epstein had knowledge from the 2016 election that "would have to cancel the election," and implies this could be a reason he was killed. He also personally suspects Donald Trump could be behind it.
